title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, principal of Mt. Blue Middle School in Farmington, criticized for Halloween costume resembling an ICE agent.
The school district acknowledged the incident occurred off school grounds and is addressing it following internal procedures.
Advocacy group Project Relief Maine condemned the costume, citing fear and trauma it may cause immigrant students.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez left the Patriots vs. Falcons game with a head injury but was cleared by concussion protocol.
Gonzalez was involved in a play where he hit his head wrestling for a catch with Atlanta's Drake London.
Despite the injury, Gonzalez expressed readiness to return, but the Patriots secured a win without needing him back.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End volunteers collected 180 needles in six days from Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting drug use and safety concerns.
Councilor Ed Flynn emphasizes zero tolerance for open drug dealing and urges for more resources in needle pick-up and recovery services.
Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly as harm reduction; residents express concern over safety and drug-related hazards in parks.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praised Jayson Tatum's Achilles recovery progress, noting Tatum is ahead in rehab compared to Durant's own timeline.
Tatum is considering a 2025-26 season return, which would be earlier than initially anticipated for his Achilles rehabilitation.
Durant expressed optimism about Tatum's return, acknowledging his talent and dedication despite the challenging recovery journey.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas achieved a career-high 100 receiving yards and a touchdown in Patriots' 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Both Douglas and Terrell Jennings played after learning of a family friend's death, each scoring a touchdown.
Jennings, promoted from practice squad, scored his first NFL touchdown with 35 yards on 11 carries for the Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots won a close 24-23 game against the Falcons at Gillette Stadium despite turnovers by Drake Maye.
Coach Mike Vrabel praised his team's effort and emphasized finding joy in their performance despite a shaky game.
Quarterback Drake Maye acknowledged his mistakes but highlighted the positives after recording 259 yards and two touchdowns.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren died unexpectedly at his Newton home at age 55, leaving behind a wife and two children.
Elected in 2009, Warren was the first African American mayor of a Massachusetts city, serving Newton until 2018.
Before his mayoral term, Warren served under President Clinton and worked for FEMA and Senator John Kerry.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' DeMario Douglas achieved his first career 100-yard receiving game, contributing significantly to their victory over the Falcons.
Drake Maye's performance was mixed, showcasing strong passing ability but also committing crucial turnovers that allowed Falcons to score.
Patriots' defensive strength limited Falcons' rushing to 70 yards, but Marcus Jones struggled defensively against taller receiver Drake London.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A survey by the Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows fewer residents feel 'less safe' compared to early 2024.
92% of survey respondents believe public safety remains an urgent issue despite feeling safer downtown.
Panelists at the Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit discussed drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure improvement.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to six, defeating Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium.
Drake Maye throws two touchdowns but turns over the ball twice against Atlanta.
Falcons' missed extra point secures Patriots' one-point victory in a tight game.
